## Current focus of development 1. Computing: the Data Frame 2. Data Visualization 3. Multivariate Thinking 4. Tools for Inference: Simulation/resampling 5. Causality ## Computing: the Data Frame ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}

````` ::: :::
. . . > **Goal**: Emphasize a recurrent data structure that is useful for understanding the unit of observation and variables. ## Data Visualization > **Goal**: Provide a theory of graphics. More practice. . . .
**Grammar of Graphics**: A statistical graphic is a mapping of *data* variables to *aesthetic* attributes of *geometric* objects. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/grammar-of-graphics.png){fig-align='center' width=70%} ::: ::: ## 3 Questions to ask of every plot ::: nonincremental 1. **Data**: What data frame do I want to depict? 2. **Aesthetics**: How do I want to map the variables of that data frame to the aesthetic attributes of the plot? 3. **Geometry**: How do I want to graphically depict the observations? ::: ## John Arbuthnot's Christening Records {auto-animate=true} ::: {.cell} ::: :::: columns ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](stat-20-redesign_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%" .fragment} ::: nonincremental - **Data**: `arbuthnot` - **Aesthetics**: map `year` to the x-axis, `total` count to the y-axis - **Geometry**: express observations as a line ::: ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(arbuthnot, aes(x = year, y = total)) + geom_line() ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## John Arbuthnot's Christening Records {auto-animate=true} :::: columns ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](stat-20-redesign_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} - **Data**: `arbuthnot` - **Aesthetics**: map `year` to the x-axis, `total` count to the y-axis - **Geometry**: express observations as **points** ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="4"} ggplot(arbuthnot, aes(x = year, y = total)) + geom_point() ``` ::: ::: :::: ## Multivariate Thinking > **Goal**: Become accustomed to thinking about the relationships between more than two variables. . . .
### Where does this come up? - Higher dimensional data visualization - Multiple regression ## Tools for Inference . . . :::: columns ::: {.column width="45%"} [Computational]{.inversebox} ::: nonincremental - Simulation - Bootstrapping - Permutation tests ::: ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: {.column width="45%" .fragment} [Mathematical]{.inversebox} ::: nonincremental - Binomial - Normal approximation - $t$-test - $\chi^2$ - $F$ ::: ::: :::: . . . > **Goal**: Simplify, build intuition, build foundation ## Causality > **Goal**: Approach causality constructively with a definition and different approaches to estimating causal effects. . . . :::: columns ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/frost.png){fig-align='center' width=715} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="6%"} ::: ::: {.column width="54%"} ::: {.nonincremental} **Counterfactual**: relating to or expressing what has not happened or is not the case. - The outcome of taking the left path. - The outcome of taking the right path. > Only one of these are observed. ::: ::: :::: ## Lab: A Matter of Taste Students devise an experiment to test a claim *before* being taught experimental design. :::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/la-croix.png){width=1131} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} - Experiments are assessed based on their clarity, reproducibility, and internal consistency, not on correctness. ::: :::: ## {background-image="images/exp-1.png" background-size="contain"} ## {background-image="images/exp-2.png" background-size="contain"} ## {background-image="images/taste-test-birdseye.png" background-size="contain"} ## {background-image="images/exp-recap.png" background-size="contain"} ## Current focus of development ::: nonincremental 1. <script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {

      // dispatch for htmlwidgets
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for reveal
    if (window.Reveal) {
      window.Reveal.addEventListener("slidechanged", function(event) {
        fireSlideChanged(event.previousSlide, event.currentSlide);
      });
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
